file_content.text: The Hutts are aware of your presence, and the isotope-5 is gone.
Yes, my lord. We have a sample, and there's more in the core, but... I failed.
Today, three planets fell to Republic butchers. I sacrificed those worlds and my legions to buy time for this operation.
You are responsible for what happens on Makeb.
I am the chosen of the Emperor. I am undefeated in battle. Do not doubt me, Marr.
I haven't lost this war yet.
I have acquiesced to your strategies so far, and I agreed to assist you. But do not lecture me on my responsibilities, Lord Marr.
I know my responsibilities.
You misunderstand.
I agreed to procure the isotope-5, and I've put myself and my people at great risk to do so. Do not assume I've finished.
I know my responsibilities.
If I believed you were finished, we would not be speaking.
You hired me to steal the isotope-5 from the Hutts. Their stockpile never existed.
I do my job; no more, no less.
You want the isotope-5 another way, that's a whole other job.
You begin to irritate me, mercenary.
You want results, I want an explanation. Isotope-5 is powerful, but what makes it the key to winning the war?
Why is the isotope so vital?
You have seen what it can do for the Hutts. Envision it in our hands--but the details must remain secret.
This operation was a failure before I arrived. The Hutts started building isotope-5 droids long ago.
Blame the Hutts, not me.
You will deal with the situation at hand.
We have a chance to forge a new Empire--an Empire united in loyalty and passion, not simplistic dedication to an unseen Emperor.
But fail to procure the isotope-5, and the Empire dies forever. Solve this.
We have been analyzing options, and our conclusion is unfortunate: We cannot extract the isotope-5 from the droids.
And we can't mine the isotope ourselves before the planet explodes. Even if the Hutts cooperated, we'd never get enough.
Then we need time.
Maybe there's another option. Could we synthesize the material? Or mine it on another world?
Can we obtain it another way?
I am not in the mood for excuses. What options do we have?
Don't test my patience.
Nadrin, is there any way to... I don't know, make a batch ourselves?
Makeb is the only known source of the isotope. The conditions under which it forms appear unique to the planet's core.
So we're back at the start. Without Makeb, there is no isotope-5.
We must preserve Makeb.
If the isotope-5 is locked in the core, and the core is about to detonate, then that's where we need to focus.
How do we slow the destruction of the planet? How do we save Makeb?
I don't know if that's possible.
Saving a planet would require significant... innovation. I can make no promises.
No one said this mission would be easy. But it sounds like you realize what we have to do.
Well... this will be tricky.
We've got a planet to save. How do we stop Makeb's destruction?
If the planet's destruction is the problem, then the solution is obvious.
You're avoiding the real task.
I don't think....
You will stabilize the core and prevent Makeb's annihilation. Or would you prefer to admit failure now?
Is that even possible?
It would require... significant innovation.
This isn't a choice. [Threaten]
Our Empire is imperiled. Makeb must be saved, or all is lost.
Your life is nothing; only your obedience matters. Begin.
It troubles me that you would hesitate.
You understand why we must do this? You see the necessity of saving Makeb? Then begin now! Immediately!
Some of you have family offworld. Friends. Maybe they should pay the cost of your failures.
I want a plan to save Makeb, and I want it now. Get to work.
How many men can this team afford to lose? Say, one per hour, until the job is done?
Find a way to save Makeb. Do it fast.
The Empire has no higher priority. Nadrin--contact the Science Bureau. Bring in any outside help you need.
We'll use all our resources.
Niar? Search Solida Hesk's databanks. Her mining company must have studied the planet's geology.
The rest of you--maintain security and assist wherever needed. We have work to do.
If I may, my lord. They're making progress, but even if we save Makeb, the timing....
They think they have something. Even if we can save the planet, though, the timing....
If the Hutts realize the planet's not about to blow, they'll never leave willingly. We can't afford a ground war; we still need them to evacuate.
The Hutts and the Republic can't learn what we're trying to do. Consider information control your priority.
Make sure our goal is secret.
We don't even know what's possible. Take it one problem at a time.
Let's not get too far ahead.
Monitor all Hutt communications. Those who suspect the truth must be eliminated.
Anyone who learns, dies.
Forgive my interruption. We are ready to present.
Taris Engineering Post here. Stabilizing Makeb's core is theoretically possible, but we don't have enough data.
Quesh Geo-survey Station. We need to induce the isotope-5 inside Makeb to release an energy pulse, allowing us to map all of its deposits.
To perform this invaluable experiment, however, you would need to travel underground to the core of the planet. We recognize the inconvenience.
Traveling kilometers below Makeb's surface won't be simple. We aren't equipped for deep-core mining.
How would we do that?
Summarize the science for me, Nadrin. What am I doing down there?
You want to do what?
Upon reaching the core, you would cause the isotope-5 deposits to... "vibrate," releasing a pulse of harmless radiation.
Our instruments could then locate the deposits. Once all unstable elements are mapped, we can consider how to safely adjust the core's composition.
The planet's already unstable. You want me to descend to the core and make it explode?
That sounds insane.
The pulse released would consist of harmless radiation... also only theoretically. This has never been tried before. I see no alternatives.
If we do this... our best access point is the laser drill shaft where the isotope-5 was originally discovered.
The shaft runs kilometers under a mining station, and it's been abandoned--so probably treacherous, but less chance of Hutt interference.
Every second, this planet comes closer to destruction. I'll go; keep working on the plan.
Let's get moving.
Why would the Hutts have abandoned the mining station?
What sort of dangers?
Still trying to open those files, but something about safety issues.
I'll permit the operation, but I don't see why I'm part of it.
This is a job for scientists.
Lord Cytharat's team is being evacuated for treatment. You're the only one left.
Lord Cytharat's team is dead. You're the only one left.
Lord Cytharat's team isn't in any shape to make it. You're the only one left.
We will provide all necessary equipment, and speak once you arrive on-site.
Be careful--the center of a planet isn't built for people.
Last one. Cytharat, your status?
My men are dead. I am alone against many... but I know my duty. Lowering the heat shield.
When you fall, it will be for the Emperor. Die well, Lord Cytharat.
You die a worthy death.
Die well, my lord Wrath.
You die serving the Dark Council. There is no greater honor.
You make a worthy sacrifice.
No, my lord. There is not.
Not every Sith would die for the Empire, Lord Cytharat. You and your men will be remembered.
I salute your sacrifice.
Thank you, Commander.
You kept your word, and you fought well. Sometimes that's all you can ask for.
It's been good knowing you.
You... are not what I expected, hunter.
Try to get to safety. We'll rendezvous on the upper levels.
Can you make it out?
No, we will not. But I thank you.
Too bad machines can't scream. Don't you agree?
Time for the droids to burn.
Yes... my lord.
For the Empire!
No signal.
You should get out before lava floods your section; we'll see you at base.
First override destroyed. Cytharat, over to you.
Three more mercenaries dead. Ha! Protect the controls!
Sergeant Tabrex is down. My technician is bleeding on the console. But we will do our part.
Heat shield at forty percent.
Program "Termination" = online
Program "Vivisection" = online
My lord!
Commander!
Hunter!
My team is attempting to aid you from the security center, but we cannot hold long. Awaiting orders!
I need options. Niar, Cytharat, Nadrin--what do you have for me?
Give me suggestions.
What's the opposing force? What's your status?
How badly are you outmatched?
I have two men down, and we face at least thirty.
I want those isotope-5 units gone. We'll leave the Archon without an army.
The droids must be destroyed.
He said he had other facilities--but it would be a blow.
Lord Cytharat? I am transmitting a schematic. Now consulting with Science Bureau Geo-Engineering Corps.
Nadrin, you're going to get them all killed.
We will do our duty.
Blast it.... Between you and Cytharat, we might be able to lower the stronghold's heat shield and flood the vault with lava.
The droids would be buried in molten rock, but I doubt Cytharat's team would survive long enough to see it.
Cytharat will obey. We lower the heat shield and obliterate those things.
Let's crush the machines.
Fine. Looks like you'll have to disrupt the vault heat shield overrides. Cytharat's adjustments and the quake damage will do the rest.
Sending schematics and locations to you now. Cytharat, you will need to use the controls after each override is destroyed.
We know our part--but move quickly. The droids shall burn.
We're not leaving Cytharat and his people to die. We're pulling out; rendezvous at the security station.
Too risky. We escape together.
Orders received.
Go fast--those droids could break free any time!
Support team--I found storage tanks, but they're mostly empty. There's only one sample left.
Confirmed. Low levels of isotope-5 persist in the background, but no immediate large quantities are present.
That can't be right. Keep looking.
The vault goes on. Nadrin, continue to scan.
I'm going farther in.
The Hutts could have transported the rest of the stockpile before we arrived. They may have known we were coming.
Maybe they moved the isotope.
We'll figure this out.
I know what I see. Doubt me again, and there will be repercussions.
Don't treat me like a fool.
I just meant--I'm sorry.
Radiation levels increasing. Multiple sources.
Identifying over two dozen power signatures. Wavelengths resemble those of the isotope-5 prototype droid.
They couldn't have....
The Hutts used it all. They used up the isotope to make a damned army!
Can we extract what we need from the droids? Could there be another stockpile?
Let's discuss options.
I have seen Darth Marr's requirements for the isotope-5. They are very specific and unusual; it is unlikely we can utilize the droids in this way.
Look, you have a sample. Get out of there before those things activate.
Darth Marr didn't ask for a legion of isotope-5 droids, but that's what he's going to get.
Then the Empire gains an army.
Lord Marr had specific plans for the isotope-5. With apologies, I do not believe the droids will suffice.
If they're not active... we need to regroup, figure this out.
Panic now, and I'll have you shot.
Enough whining!
I'm focused. All right--you've got a sample; get out of there before the droids come online.
Please. Stay.
I am Szajin, First Archon of the New Hutt Empire and shadow chief of the conquest-world Makeb.
And you are the newest lord of the Dark Council. I'd been wondering about your presence here--but of course, you wanted the isotope.
I'd been wondering about the Empire's presence here for some time--but of course, you wanted the isotope.
You thought the Empire defeated and grasped for power. You should not have drawn our attention.
The Hutt Cartel overreached.
It was an error, perhaps--but not a grievous one.
You know who I am, and you are not of my station. My words are for the Supreme Mogul; who is that today?
I would speak to your leader.
The Supreme Mogul commands. I guide, and protect the old ways.
"Shadow chief." You're in charge of Hutt espionage.
You and me, spy against spy.
Well done. And you... the things I heard about the last of the Empire's agents. Perhaps... but no matter.
Who I work for and what I'm paid for isn't your business.
I don't snitch on my clients.
Ha! Oh, bounty hunter... you should have stayed with Nem'ro on Hutta.
I've never heard of a Hutt "Archon." Or met a Hutt who spoke Basic.
Who and what are you?
The title dates to an age when the Hutt autarchs ruled; you would not remember. I speak Basic so I know you understand.
Fancy titles and arrogance won't stop me from cutting you in two.
You smug, dead slimeball.
Nor will cutting me in two win you anything.
The only isotope-5 left on Makeb is locked in the planet's core--and when that explodes, there won't be any left at all.
Our army of droids is being assembled at facilities across the planet. Your Empire has nothing--rumor is, even your Emperor is missing.
What if I were willing to make a deal? What do you want in return for the isotope?
Let's reach an agreement.
I want to reconquer the galaxy and restore glory to my people, of course.
Tell me what you know about those rumors. The Sith Emperor....
What about the Emperor?
The Sith Emperor is presumed dead by the Jedi. They're almost ready to go public with the claim--but that's all I know.
Now let us see how many droids it takes to eliminate you. More than one, I wager--but not many.
I have no interest in hearing a Hutt gloat.
Enough of this. [Attack]
This is Lord Cytharat! There are reinforcements coming--we're under attack!
Program "Evisceration" = online
The reprogramming is working. Nadrin and Lord Cytharat should be able to fire the guns.
That was impressive. All right. You should be close to the central vault; the isotope-5 will be in there.
Support to ground team. Cytharat's men got us into Stronghold One's scanners. Radiation levels spike just ahead of you.
This is Nadrin. I believe that the radiation levels indicate the Hutts' isotope-5 prototype droid is active.
This is our last chance to strategize. How do I destroy that thing?
How do I fight it?
After all this time, I'm looking forward to seeing what this isotope can do.
Finally... isotope-5.
Of course the droid is active. Otherwise, this mission would go according to plan.
Nothing's ever easy.
We knew it was a strong possibility.
Conventional weaponry could theoretically penetrate the droid's shields. In practice, the firepower required would equal... seven-point-eight.
Seven-point-eight what?
Molecular disruption units, as defined by the Skakoan weaponeers. Apologies for the nonstandard measure.
It may be possible to complement your personal weaponry with Stronghold One's automated defenses. You would need to survive long enough to reprogram the facility's guns.
Stronghold One's weaponry is significant. Let's hear your plan, Nadrin.
Give me details.
What about taking control of the prototype? It could be a major asset.
Could I reprogram the droid?
Unfortunately, its systems are separate from the facility's.
Transferring data. Upload this software into the automated defenses; I will humbly work with Lord Cytharat to target the isotope-5 droid.
Get ready, then.
And good luck in there, ground team.
More firepower won't change the situation. The droid must be destroyed, and I will do the task myself.
Better to just fight it.
This team could be responsible for working with Lord Cytharat to control the guns. Your part would only require uploading the programs.
That's enough. The decision is made.
Good luck in there.
Life-forms = detected // Identification = failed
Life-form = detected // Identification = failed
Program "Elimination" = online
Support to ground team. The main security office is nearby; if you take control, you can open the lower levels.
This is the ground team. Preparing to detonate charges.
Acknowledged.
Status report?
Observing power fluctuations. Stronghold One's first tier security protocols are nonfunctional.
There's a general alarm going out, but that's standard for a groundquake of this magnitude.
And the stronghold won't be getting reinforcements while the Hutts are putting down the revolt. You're clear to go inside.
Before the day is over, we'll have the isotope-5 and be off this world.
It'll all be finished soon.
We'll support you however we can.
Do we have schematics? Security rosters? What am I facing in there?
Any details on the interior?
Sending the blueprints now. We know the place is full of Regulator mercenaries and Hutt Cartel specialists, but we're light on details.
Lord Cytharat's team will follow you in and hold the upper levels open. Good luck.
Your part is over. I want silence while I work.
Keep the chatter down.
Understood. Mission-critical transmissions only.
The last of the charges are in place. Support team, confirm.
Confirmed, my lord. We'll get a major groundquake when those go off.
Confirming. We'll get a major groundquake when those go off.
Recommend you find shelter before detonation. The mercenaries' landing pad isn't far--should be sturdy enough not to collapse.
Heading to the landing pad now. Keep me informed.
On my way.
What about the Hutts and Lord Cytharat's team?
Everything else on schedule?
The Hutts and the mercenaries are still busy with the revolt. Lord Cytharat and his strike team are on a mesa three kilometers north, waiting for word.
We're all set. It's over to you.
"Should be" is not an acceptable degree of risk.
You don't sound certain.
No, of course not. Nadrin?
Safety standards for Makeb government installations are high. The landing pad will be damaged, but occupants are not at risk. Transmitting research citations now.
We're ready for the detonation when you are.
First detonator set. All teams on schedule.
We're picking up wildlife down there with you. We're guessing the quakes are disturbing the ecosystem... doesn't help you, I suppose.
Registering the detonator. Still no Hutt activity detected.
Sixteen settlements in rebellion, two mining crews taking hostages--and now the Republic military!
My teams say they're outgunned. Tell the Hutts to get us aerial support, or the Regulators walk.
The Hutts took our planet from us. Now we take it back!
Every channel. Much the same.
My lord.
Sir.
We're guessing a few hours before the fighting settles. That's our window to break into Stronghold One and steal the isotope-5.
You've had time to prepare. Show me everything.
Brief me on your plan.
How are the rebels faring against the mercenaries and the Hutt armada?
Who's winning the battle?
Most of the rebel leaders are dead, but they've taken a piece out of the enemy for us. Best we could hope for.
They fight bravely. They will not win this day... but give them time.
Can you get me the Stronghold One data?
A proper greeting. Maybe you've learned your lesson.
You show respect. Good.
All I want is to finish the mission.
If Makeb's core explodes first, the fighting and our break-in won't matter.
Unless the planet blows.
We've got a specialist now. He's watching the geostability matrix, so we'll have some warning.
Stronghold One.
Right. The vault facility is built into a volcanic mesa, with a single entrance above the magma. It's also got sensors, alarms... enough to catch any thief who gets inside.
We don't want to alert the Hutts before we have to. Can we neutralize the systems?
We need the security disabled.
Our science consultant has a proposal.
You said the place was built by the Makeb government. That's an impressive amount of security, even for a government vault.
A volcano seems... excessive.
Makeb was built on mineral wealth, but because of the problems shipping off-planet, storing valuables was an issue.
Our science consultant has a way around the security, though.
Once we're in, it will be too late to stop us. The Hutts' forces are already occupied.
Who cares if they see us?
Lockdown is still a problem--can't have them trapping you inside--but our science consultant has an answer.
It is pleasing. Nadrin Tro, on loan from the New Thinking Division of the Science Bureau.
A series of high-powered explosives, safely detonated in the caves around the volcanic crater, could simulate a seismic wave.
The resulting groundquake would destroy much of Stronghold One's equipment while appearing to be a "natural phenomenon." Security would be relegated to backups.
Assuming I proceed with a frontal assault... what then?
What will I face inside?
I haven't seen your species with the Science Bureau before.
You're an Imperial scientist?
Recent addition. I hope to prove that we are of some meager use to the Empire.
A few tonnes of rubble should soften the opposition. Then I move in for the kill.
Let's bury the enemy, then.
My squad will follow your initial insertion to cover your escape route.
Once inside, expect heavy resistance: Regulator mercenaries and automated security, yes, but also specialists loyal to the Hutt Cartel.
There's also the Hutts' prototype isotope-5 droid--assuming it's online, which we probably should. Still trying to find its weak points, but we're out of time.
Let's assume none of this proves a problem. How do I move the isotope-5 stockpile?
How will I steal the isotope?
It has to be more than a name and a power source. What can the droid do?
Get me intel on the droid.
Accessing Science Bureau database. Consulting with Doctor Nivo.
Defensive capabilities may include ray and particle shielding; possible gravity field. Offensive capabilities may include high-energy lasers and radiation discharges.
Well... if the droid is able to kill me, we'll know for sure that isotope-5 is worth the trouble.
Guess that'll be interesting.
We'll keep working on the problem.
We estimate the Hutts've mined about a hundred kilos of isotope-5. You'll be able to move it by hand with Cytharat's help.
I think that's everything. We're at your service.
The scheming is finished. The time for hiding, too, is over. Today, we will crush the Hutts and claim the isotope-5 for the Empire!
Follow me into battle.
For the Empire.
For the Empire!
You have done well under trying circumstances. Now is the final test, but I assure you: The Dark Council is proud.
The Empire salutes you.
Today, we do what must be done. Today, we save the Empire.
My lord.
My lord.
We've prepared as well as we can, but that guarantees nothing. Assume the plan will be compromised; our job is to succeed regardless.
Stay focused, team.
Understood.
Once the isotope-5 is offworld, transfer the credits to my account. Everything else I can handle myself.
Get my payment ready.
Take care of the Empire, we'll take care of you.
Things are about to get tense. What's the mood of your people?
How's your team holding up?
Frankly? No one came here expecting to survive--but we all want to see it through.
This is our redemption.
Not for all of us. Sergeant Bedareux is doing it for his family. Hanthor wants to set an example for his people.
But we're ready to save the Empire. You'll get the isotope-5 offworld.
You didn't mention your own reasons for coming along.
Why are you here?
I'm here because cataloging cargo for the Ministry of Logistics didn't seem enough anymore.
Plan your funerals another time. I mean to get all of you out alive.
No one dies if I can help it.
Sort of a bonus, then. Thanks.
Nadrin, send that data on where to plant the explosives. Cytharat, get your team ready. All hands--let's go.
Do your job and let's go.
Get me the data and the explosives for the groundquake. If anything goes wrong, it's on your head.
Just don't mess up.
My lord.
Sir!
This is Niar to all teams: We are go. Lock down comms in three, two, one....
The hovertanks have been destroyed, and the mercenaries have been routed.
Dark Lord.
My lord.
We have observed the enemy's flight. Riots have begun across the planet.
The Hutts just authorized the execution of any civilians not carrying ID. The mercenaries are demanding a raise.
We were counting on that much. Is there something else?
You said you had news.
Lord Cytharat should come with me next time. Staying in the gravity hook means he misses all the action.
[Flirt] Join up, Cytharat.
We will fight together on the battlefield soon enough. For now, the honor is mine to watch you.
What sort of people terrorize and execute innocents for money?
The mercenaries are sickening.
I've killed people for money. But those men are animals.
The mercenaries are sickening.
To shed blood for one's home, one's beliefs is glorious. There is no glory here.
There is something else.
You're sure we can't convince the Regulators to change sides?
Too bad we can't hire them.
They're not loyal to the Hutts, but we can't outbid the Cartel, either.
Some of the civilian leadership seems reluctant to take this opportunity to strike. We think they're laying low and regrouping.
But if we're going to steal the isotope-5, we need the civilian leaders organizing a full-on revolt. If I set up a meet, can you push them?
One way or another, I will ensure they go to war.
They will see reason.
Yes, my lord.
I've earned the loyalty of Jedi, cults and military leaders. Provincial revolutionaries will be nothing.
Persuasion is my specialty.
Of course.
I've played diplomat more than once. I'll make it go our way.
I know how to be convincing.
Much obliged, Commander.
Diplomacy isn't my specialty, but I can try to make a revolutionary see the light.
Not my usual, but okay.
We've given the people opportunity and motive to fight--why would their leaders hold back?
How can they be reluctant?
Caution and fear.
Yeah.
When I run out of patience, people die. Will that be suitable?
My negotiations get bloody.
Might be. Really up to you.
There's a man named Pollus Avesta who's got influence with the rebels. He's holed up at an old plantation.
You've already got half the planet riled up. Win over Avesta, and he'll make sure everyone's pointing the right way.
This is support team. The mercenaries are pulling out of the settlements, and I've got news. See if you can find a secure holoterminal.
We've got to have topographic scans, satellite imagery, something....
You survive. It is a good day.
Mighty Wrath.
My lord. You honor us.
Commander.
Hunter.
Right. Welcome back.
We found the isotope-5's location in Hesk's files. The bad news? Getting to it is a problem. The good news? Makeb won't explode for weeks, so why worry?
Tell me the location of the stockpile. I want to move as soon as possible.
Where is the isotope-5?
The destruction of Makeb changes everything. That has to be our priority.
We should focus on the planet.
With respect? It doesn't change anything. Our objective is the isotope-5, and once we're gone, the planet's fate isn't our business.
She is right. The Hutts doomed this world, but it is our Empire at stake.
Then we move on. You said you had the isotope's location?
True enough.
Makeb has a population. I won't have millions die because of the Hutts.
What about the people?
Right. Your call. Our resources are limited--but we'll look at options. In the meantime, we'll give you what we know.
If you're wrong about the timeline, we could find ourselves standing on an exploding planet.
If Makeb dies, we go with it.
I'll make it the science consultant's top priority. In the meantime, there's this:
I've tolerated your lack of discipline, but there are limits. When I enter, you will honor me as your lord and master.
Show me proper respect.
What? I'm trying--forgive me, my lord. It won't happen again.
The Hutts store their isotope in Stronghold One. It is Makeb's treasury, built to be impenetrable.
I'm in command of this operation. When you report, you give me your attention and your respect.
Show me some respect.
Understood, sir.
The Hutts are keeping the isotope at Stronghold One--it's a massive vault built by the government for Makeb's treasury.
One entrance. Unbreachable walls. Six layers of security.
Six, plus a prototype being assembled by the Hutts. Some kind of isotope-5-powered droid in the early stages. We're going to need time to plan.
If Stronghold One is where the isotope is held, then how do we get inside without drawing the Hutts' attention?
Then let's make a plan.
What about a distraction? There's a message we intercepted....
This prototype--what are its capabilities? How close is it to coming online?
Tell me about the droid.
We're not sure yet, and we also need to worry about the Hutts crashing down on us once we make our move.
We require a distraction. Show the intercepted message.
The Dark Council rules this Empire. I should be on Korriban or Dromund Kaas, but I am needed here.
You don't have time. [Shock her]
Yet time and again, you delay. Find me a way to the isotope, or you will be replaced.
My life for yours, my lord.
I came to this forsaken planet for one purpose, and time and again, you say we are not ready!
You don't have time. [Choke her]
No more warnings. You are not irreplaceable.
I would die for my Empire, lord.
My lord. Strike now, and the Hutts will come in force. Your power is supreme, yet it will be impossible to move the isotope offworld.
What do I have to do to make you understand? We can't keep delaying!
You don't have time.
I would die for my Empire, sir. But I don't know what else to do.
If I may? Strike now, and the Hutts will come in force. You may slay them, yet it will be impossible to move the isotope offworld.
But if the Hutts are distracted, they can do nothing. Show the mercenary message.
InterStellar Regulator Command to the Archon: The civilians are getting restless. Had to stop a riot today, and it'll get worse if the Republic's involved.
We're moving the hovertanks into settlements. That'll keep them locked down, and we'll level city blocks if we have to.
Imagine a world in revolt. With their attention on the civilians, the Hutts could not afford to move against us.
Wouldn't take much to start a revolt. Worldwide rebellion, and the Hutts won't have the manpower to keep us from the isotope.
If the mercenaries are keeping the civilians in line, it's the mercenaries we need to target. That transmission mentioned hovertanks...?
We need to unleash the people.
If we start a revolution now, people will die fighting the Hutts.
Civilians aren't mere tools.
Then we'll give them a chance to win?
You could free the settlements.
Support a revolution and doom countless lives... all so we can steal an isotope. I approve.
Twisted and fun.
We'd have to free the settlements somehow.
Hovertanks are the vanguard of the mercenary army--armored and powerful. If you destroy them, the people could rally.
What about propaganda? Couldn't we send a message? Incite them somehow?
Tell them about mercenary atrocities, and how the Republic has made a deal with the Hutts. Make them afraid.
Lie to them. Confuse them.
It will be done.
Spread the word that Hutt mining operations have doomed the planet. The truth should be enough.
Use the truth: Makeb is dying.
As you wish. I'll leak the files.
If you can destroy the hovertanks, I'll keep you up to date on the status of the revolution.
You go to war against the Hutts today. It will be an honor to observe.
Support team--the docking ring is secure. You may proceed to board.
Take positions, everyone. Bedareux, scan the base. Captain Hanthor--you're on comms.
My lord... lord of the council! I had--I wasn't informed you were the ground team. Sorry if I seemed... too casual.
My lord. My lord Wrath. I didn't realize they were sending--sorry. If I seemed... casual.
You're the commander. I... didn't know you'd be on the ground.
You're the bounty hunter who used to work with Darth Tormen, aren't you? Well, at least they're spending money.
You're the ground team, then. All right, not... quite what I was expecting.
Sir! The Hutts are calling, but we've got what we need to fake a response. What answer should I send?
Tell the Hutts that we had a shielding failure and radiation levels are rising. We have it under control, but we're temporarily quarantining the gravity hook.
Tell them our tech is broken.
Do it.
This is your plan. Don't let me interfere.
You make the decision.
Tell them we're experiencing power fluctuations and need to shut down for repairs.
Understood.
The angrier Hutts get, the stupider they become. Give it time, then use your faked response.
Keep the slugs waiting.
You heard the order--do it.
I'm Katha Niar, by the way. Eight years Ministry of Logistics, three months black-ops coordinator--times being what they are.
Lord Cytharat. Tactical advisor. My life for you, my loyalty to the Empire.
I'm here to organize the team and facilitate your needs. He'll suggest people to kill.
I'm certain you'll suffice. What next, now that we have a base of operations?
On to business, then.
You pledge your life to me, but who made you Sith? I would know your loyalties.
Who's your master, Cytharat?
The traitor Darth Malgus brought me out of the academy. I am here to pay for his crimes; the Empire must be united.
Logistics to black ops is an unusual transition. Care to elaborate?
How'd you move to black ops?
Not really. Manpower shortages and no Imperial Intelligence; family proposed I fill the gap.
Darth Marr said I was in charge of this operation. So you'll follow my commands?
Do I get to give the orders?
Gladly. Sir.
My life for you.
"Lord" Cytharat--not a Darth--and a former logistics officer? It's disgraceful.
You're both unfit for duty.
We weren't picked for reputation. We're here because we have the right skills--and because we'll die for you and the mission.
Those files are ready, sir.
If we're going to steal Makeb's isotope-5 stockpile, we don't have much time. Once the Hutts figure out what we're after, they'll shut down our escape route.
Fleets burn over Balmorra to buy us this opportunity. We mustn't waste it.
Our proposed target is Solida Hesk. Mining corporation executive; secretly worked with the Hutts to study isotope-5 and sell out the planet.
She's hosting half a dozen Hutts and their bodyguards at her private resort--but if there's anyone who knows where the isotope is stored, it's her.
The Hutts won't be prepared for an assault. We cut through them and take the woman before they realize what's happening.
Then we hit hard and fast.
Agreed. I can offer you tactical data on-site.
You're my tactical advisor. Step up and impress me.
[Flirt] Thoughts, Cytharat?
It might take a better man than I--but I shall do what I can.
Can we continue?
A covert assault on Solida Hesk's estate would take the Hutts by surprise. I can provide tactical data once you arrive.
With that many Hutts in one place, the resort will be secure. What about drawing her elsewhere?
Can we lure her out?
Possible, but her terminals at home are hooked into the company database. We may need them anyway.
A covert assault is best. I will have tactical feeds for you once you arrive.
Executives who consort with Hutts don't hold up under interrogation. How do I find her?
I can make her talk.
A covert assault on the resort. I will provide tactical data once you arrive.
Transportation will be ready soon. You can break in, question her and get her to turn over control of the corporate computers.
Any words to your team before you go?
For a thousand years, our society has stood as a monument to glory and power. Now the Jedi seek our destruction once again.
We do this for the Emperor!
But we will prevail. For the last of the Sith Emperors lives still, and it is for him that we fight.
Live for the Emperor! Die for the Emperor!
We live for the Emperor.
We die for the Emperor.
The Empire is on the verge of destruction. Our brothers battle the Republic half a galaxy away while we are here, in a den of worms.
Today, we make a stand....
Nonetheless, we fight for Imperial glory. We fight for our homeland and our birthright. We fight for our rightful place among the stars!
And though none will ever hear us if we fall--if we succeed, our names will be carved in the stones of Korriban forever.
I am of the Dark Council. But today, I lay my life down with you. For the Empire!
For the Empire!
For the Empire.
The operation will be difficult. We're alone on a hostile world, with no support and no backup if things go wrong.
We'll succeed, but it's tough.
But this team is here because you were judged ready for a difficult operation. I know each of you will do your best. I know you'll do me proud.
Now let's get started.
I'm here because I'm paid to be here. You're here because you're dedicated to the Empire.
I'm honored to serve with you.
But I intend to do right by my contract. I won't let you down.
I will not tolerate incompetence. Failure will be punished with death; insubordination will be addressed more harshly.
Fail and you die.
If you wish to survive Makeb, you will obey my commands.
We will obey.
We will obey.
We will obey.
Do what you came to do, and don't look at me for inspiration.
I don't make speeches.
Support team to ground--we're in a shuttle and ready to dock as soon as you have control.
I've got another favor to ask, though. See if you can get the mercenaries' Hutt overseer talking. I'd like a voiceprint from him.
The overseer may not be cooperative. Still, I can extract a few words.
Let me see what I can do.
Do you always take souvenirs from your enemies, or is the overseer special?
Are you making a collection?
Get his voiceprint, and we can synthesize it when the Hutts come calling.
He'll die painfully. That's my only guarantee.
Try recording his screams.
Wonderful. That'll make fantastic audio if we need to fake a call to the Hutts.
I don't care about the all-clear signal--I want a visual link to Regulator post 2X3!
I'll keep trying, sir.
Do not bother. I know what happened.
The Empire on Makeb. Why? What happens here is not your concern.
Sith on Makeb. Why? What happens here is not your concern.
You are not a hired gun. You are a military commando, sent by... who? The Republic?
Makeb has something the Empire needs. The Hutt Cartel is in the way.
We're here for the isotope-5.
I will tell the Archon when you are dead. My master will be very interested.
Bounty hunter, yes? Why involve yourself with this? The Hutt Cartel makes a bad enemy.
I've worked with the Cartel before. It didn't end well.
Hutts and I don't get along.
Then you are not worthy.
Tell your men to put down their weapons, and no one has to get hurt. You can't win this fight.
One chance: Surrender.
These mercenaries cannot win the fight. But for all my life, I am a warrior of the Hutts--I will prevail.
[Remain silent]
Prepare to fire!
When you are dead, I will send your remains to the Archon for examination. My master will be very interested.
You don't even realize what worms you serve.
You pathetic lapdog.
Your heretic tongue will never speak again!
Your master--what's his role in the Hutt Cartel?
Who is the Archon?
The Archon is the knife in the shadows, cutting the throats of our enemies... and he has vision.
But you will never meet him.
You're finished.
Enough. [Attack]
This is orbital support to ground. Repeat, support team to ground. Codes verified.
I don't know who you are, and with the Hutts trying to listen in, I don't want to. Just tell me your condition.
We're ready to move out. What is the plan, support team?
Awaiting your report.
I may have left some teeth on the shuttle. Otherwise, I'm alright.
I'm in one piece, thanks.
Minimal damage. Got it.
I am rage incarnate. That is all you need know.
Think of me as your nightmare.
You needn't know my name. Serve and worship me, and it will suffice.
Understand that I rule here.
Sith, then. Yes... my lord.
The Empire's getting better at operational security. Condition normal; report.
Good to see some paranoia.
I'm alive. As for who I am, let's say I have a reputation for jobs like this.
You're talking to the best.
That'll have to do.
Top priority is to establish a corridor on- and offworld. My team needs access planetside, and you need an exfiltration route.
Shuttle flights are unreliable, but Makeb has gravity hooks for slow-speed cargo transport. Ground-to-atmosphere turbolifts, ready for capture.
Gravity hooks... if we want to take and hold one, we'll need one that's isolated--we can't draw attention. Your assessment?
Show me their weak point.
Sending coordinates of a recommended site now.
These planetary turbolifts... they're not normally used for passengers?
How do the gravity hooks work?
Takes too much time and power to be worth it. Even for cargo, they're not great, but they'll do for us.
You can survive a rough landing. We secure a landing pad, we keep things simple.
Stick with the shuttles.
Just a minute.... Logistics confirms a shuttle ride would trash our equipment. Unless you've got an alternative, we need the gravity hook.
Opposition will be heavy. When the Hutts took Makeb, they paid off the planet's defense force--veteran mercenary band called the InterStellar Regulators.
But sweep the bunkers around Gravity Hook Seven, and you can wipe out the mercenaries and signal the all-clear. Then hit the gravity hook itself fast and quiet.
There will be no need for silence. There will be no survivors to spread fear.
No one will hear them scream.
If you can do that, I won't stop you.
I am a Lord of the Sith Empire. I am the darkness that consumes. Be assured that nothing will escape.
Whole worlds fall before me.
Yes, my lord.
Send me all the data you have and leave it to me.
Standard sweep. Got it.
Mercenaries who change sides at the first sign of credits are thugs. I'm a professional.
I see my contracts through.
I bet you are.
These "InterStellar Regulators"--what are they trained for? Could they be bribed a second time?
Any more on the mercenaries?
Lots of soldiers from the Great War working Makeb for retirement. The Regulators aren't pushovers, but I'll look into a payoff.
When this is over and we meet, you will learn respect for the one in command.
Remember who's in charge here.
I didn't mean disrespect. Just using the plan I have.
I'll stay online, but until we're planetside, comms will be patchy. And there's one other thing:
Watch out for groundquakes. Couple of tremors hit the planet recently, and you don't want to get swallowed whole.
At your command.
I'll keep the science team on-task. Let us know when you reach the drill site.
We're ready to go when you are. Stronghold One... let's hope this works.
The Regulators will be ready for a fight. Watch your back.
Transport is ready. We'll await word once you arrive at Solida Hesk's estate.
